United States.description: The United States declared independence from Great Britain on July 4, 1776. It has played a major role in global history, particularly during the 20th century as a world leader.

France.description: France was a major player in the Age of Enlightenment, and it was also where the French Revolution began in 1789, which profoundly influenced modern political ideologies.

India.description: India gained independence from British rule on August 15, 1947, following a long struggle led by figures such as Mahatma Gandhi, who advocated non-violence.

China.description: China is one of the world's oldest civilizations, with a history of over 3,000 years. The Great Wall, built to protect against invasions, remains one of its most iconic symbols.
